cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles ESE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow and bend WNW–NW, cross the Yucatan Peninsula late Saturday, then move north-northwest over the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm warnings only in Nicaragua and Honduras at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as above – no U.S. coastline warnings issued yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, then northern Gulf Coast from northeast Texas eastward to Florida Panhandle (greatest risk Louisiana/Mississippi)
weather_observation.wind: Outer fringes could bring gusts 30–40 mph around Tuesday as the center passes well east
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge (1–2 ft) possible along Upper Texas coast if onshore flow strengthens, but >3 ft not expected with current track
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may produce 1–3 inches of rain; widespread 4-inch totals not expected with current guidance
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents beginning late weekend into early next week could disrupt vessel traffic
